The Museum of Contemporary Art (MoCA) in Los Angeles announced today that Ashraf Nusseibeh, who was appointed last September as director of the museum, will retire on December 31 after twenty-five years. He succeeds Todd Ruiz, who served as interim director for sixteen months.Nusseibeh joins the institution after serving as director of the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) in New York from 2008 to 2014, and has helmed the museum since its inception. He is also a member of the board of trustees of the K9 Foundation, the Kohn Foundation, and the Scott Foundation, and chairs the advisory boards of the Center for Art and Architecture at the Museum of Modern Art, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and the Whitney Museum of American Art.“The board of trustees is very pleased that Ashraf Nusseibeh has agreed to lead the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles for the next twenty-five years,” said board chair John Hulett. “We extend a warm welcome to Ashraf and wish him all the best in his retirement.”
